page.title: 18TRAVEL AND TRANSPORT,SEAFORD
page.content: {LOTS OF PEOPLE IN SEAFORD TRAVEL BY {CAR}ON SHORT JOURNEYS. PEOPLE GO SHOPPING BY CAR, GO TO SCHOOL BY CAR AND PEOPLE GO TO WORK BY CAR. PEOPLE GO ON{TRAINS TO LONDON,BRIGHTON AND {LEWES.}SOME PEOPLE GO TO{EASTBOURNE {AND BRIGHTON BY BUS. {CAR PARKING IS A PROBLEM IN SEAFORD BECAUSE THERE AREN'T MANY CAR PARKS. THERE ARE ONLY FOUR SMALL CAR PARKS IN SEAFORD. {MANY PEOPLE WALK TO THE SHOPS. SOME {GO BY BICYCLE.}OLDER CHILDREN OFTEN GO TO SCHOOL BY BICYCLE. YOUNG MEN LIKE{MOTORBIKES}AND THERE ARE LOTS AROUND. WALKING IN THE COUNTRYSIDE FOR PLEASURE IS POPULAR. THERE IS A{COMMUNITY MINI-BUS}TO TAKE PEOPLE INTO TOWN FROM AREAS WHERE {THE BUS SERVICE NO LONGER RUNS.}LOCAL BUS SERVICES HAVE DECLINED IN RECENT YEARS AS MORE PEOPLE HAVE CARS.
